title: Las Palmeras 2014 Red (Monterey County)
description: Slightly sour black fruit meets charcoal and hints of pyrazine on the nose of this blended red. Dried blueberry combines with loamy earth on the palate.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Jas des Vignes Rosé (Alpes-de-Hautes-Provence)
description: The wine is unexpectedly perfumed by the addition of Muscat. That gives the wine a full character, including touches of spice and acidity. The wine is unbalanced, the fruit and the spice at odds.

title: Txakoli Primo 2016 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Spain)
description: Tropical fruit and honey aromas set up a shy palate that's lightly spritzy. An odd mix of flowery honeyed flavors turns in the direction of pink grapefruit on a lean spritzy finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Rosé (Rioja)
description: Fruit-salad aromas include a note of chewing gum. This feels basic, with tart vapid tomato flavors. A saucy-tasting finish is bland as a board.

title: Enate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosado (Somontano)
description: Controlled volatility on the nose sets the state for a blocky clumsy palate with no finesse. Lightly vegetal flavors of red bell pepper lack fruit and overall this is mediocre at best.

title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This has medicinal herb and adhesive bandage aromas that carry over to the lean palate. Racy acidity and a bitter note give it a firm, brisk finish.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Lenda Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A briny-smelling nose is lacking in ripe appealing fruit. This feels pithy and oily, while bitter briny flavors come up short on fruit and friendliness. Pyrazines and bitterness control the finish.

title: El Solar de Orfila 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This is a green Cabernet, no two ways of cutting it. The nose is all herbs and bell pepper, while in the mouth this feels ultradry and drawing. A buttery oak flavor is unintegrated and fails to help out underripe berry and pepper notes.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Flat and somewhat disjointed, this wine offers a strong taste of eucalyptus in a light-bodied, simply structured frame.

title: Canoe Ridge 2016 The Expedition Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Light aromas of candle wax, kiwi and citrus lead to diluted fruit flavors. It lacks a sense of cohesion or variety.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of rhubarb and red-apple skins lead to a flat, fading palate. This tastes saucy, with no vibrancy or fruit character prior to a dying yeasty finish.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Broken-down aromas of haystack and sulfur are sketchy. This feels pinched, citric and rubbery, while salty sour flavors fail to suggest any particular fruit. As a whole, not much good is going on with this Chardonnay.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Organic Wine  (Rioja)
description: Funky horsey murky aromas suggest compost and sweaty animal. A blocky grabby palate and disjointed woody and weedy flavors finish with foxy notes. Nothing about this organic wine impresses.

title: CVNE 2016 Cune Rosado (Rioja)
description: Strained aromas are slightly volatile and vinegary. This feels chunky and lacking in shape. Bitter flavors are fruitless and a touch spoiled. The finish is not convincing.

title: Matarromera 2016 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The electric-purple color and foxy aromas of syrupy berry fruits and yeast should put you on red alert. In the mouth, this is heavy, overly acidic and rock-hard in terms of tannins. Grapy sour stunted flavors match the color, aromas and mouthfeel.

title: Peter Cellars 2014 Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Perfumed with leather and black pepper, this wine is ultimately overly tart and flatly structured.

title: Marqués de Vizhoja 2015 Señor da Folla Verde White (Rías Baixas)
description: Gold in color then flat and oxidized on the nose, this chunky soft blend of Albariño, Treixadura and Loureira is over the hill. Oxidized stale yeasty flavors are fruitless on the finish.

title: Sola 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a light color, earthy and herbal scents, a tart cherry flavor and a dry finish.

title: Aidura 2015 White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Color doesn't always mean a lot, but in this case a burnished gold-meets-tan color indicates that this is tired and fading. Aromas of commercial apple juice are sweet but bland. This feels a bit citric but without bounce. The mix of spent lees and cidery flavors finish bready.

title: Region 1 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Clove and clam shell aromas are strange and not enticing. This feels grabby and scratchy, with a strong covering of clove on top of dry tomato and tart berry flavors. A raw finish is abrasive in feel.

title: Coto de Hayas 2013 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Right from the start, this is all about oak and not about quality fruit, balance or subtlety. Aromas of wood resin, milk chocolate and char lead to a rugged rough palate. Flavors of burnt wood and stewed fruit finish resiny. Year after year, Fagus smells and tastes like this: it's time for a reboot.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Sensual Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Reedy weedy aromas include notes of motor oil and leafy berry fruits. This tastes as weedy as it smells, with underripe herbal berry flavors that never shed an overriding green essence.

title: La Val 2016 Más Que 2 White (Rías Baixas)
description: Pinched austere aromas of cat pee and oily sweat are extreme and unusual for a Rías Baixas wine. A citric and raw palate tastes like this smells. Fresh acidity is about all this underripe, sour and bitter blend of Albariño, Treixadura and Loureira has going for it.

title: Callia 2015 Alta Cabernet Sauvignon (Tulum Valley)
description: This smells confected—neither natural nor convincing. Vanilla and milk chocolate aromas recall a cheap ice cream sundae. This feels scattered and hollow. Plum and chocolate flavors taste artificial and forced.

title: Love 2015 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: This yeasty funky Chardonnay is on its last legs. The mouthfeel is mealy and the flavors are dull, yeasty, generic and lightly oxidized on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Casa Ferreirinha 2008 Barca-Velha Red (Douro)
description: This is the latest release of what has long been regarded as Portugal's iconic wine. And it is magnificent. The last vintage was the 2004 and the wait has now shown to be worthwhile. With its immense span and breadth of flavors and rich structure it is a superb manifestation of the great vineyards of the Douro Superior. Big bold fruits and acidity are matched by the tannins and concentration. Hold this for many years or at least wait until 2022.

title: Limerick Lane 2014 Rocky Knoll Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: A perennial knockout, this vintage delivers as always, combining 7% Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah from the estate into the mix. Altogether, it opens in a field of wildflowers aromatic before unfurling tart acidity to keep freshly layered soft, supple tannin and red cherry and berry. Sprinklings of white pepper and clove factor in.

title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2015 Abtsberg Beerenauslese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: Silken, honeyed layers of sweet-tart peach and mango undulate from the core of this stunning beerenauslese. Its unctuous sweetness is head-spinning, but vibrant lemon-lime acidity and dusty, earthy complexities keep it grounded. It's delicious already but sure to improve through 2050 and beyond.

title: Clos de la Tech 2012 Domaine Du Docteur Rodgers Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This bottling from a winery that uses both the highest of technology and most old school of techniques is incredibly subtle at first, but then come waves of mace, mulberry, forest floor and dried shiitake aromas. The palate starts with sharper herbs and spice, from thyme to nutmeg and allspice, and then the purple flower flavors explode like a bouquet in the mouth. Elderflower touches fly into the finish.

title: Robert Weil 2015 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Luminous peach and tangerine flavors take center stage in this gorgeously composed sweet Riesling. Lip-smacking honey and candied orange peel flavors are offset by a dazzling streak of citrusy acidity. Despite all the sweetness, the finish is pristinely mineral. It's stunning already but should only improve through 2050.
